item.title: How do I make the whole world Non Wild?
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:28, topic:155005”]public boolean isInArea(int x, int y, int x2, int y2) {
if ((absX >= x && absX <= x2) && (absY <= y && absY >= y2)) return true;
if (isInArea(1000, 11000, 1000, 11000)) ???
return false;
}

I figured it out, but i dont know what to put on the end… what does return mean?[/quote]

lol no mannnn look at this topic

look at this, this guy invented the isInArea method
http://www.rune-server.org/showthread.php?t=23705

he made the isInArea thing reading his page you wil understand it completely!

you cannot use if(isInArea inside isInArea that doesn’t make sense lol you gotta use it in attack player

item.title: How do I make the whole world Non Wild?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:28, topic:155005”]public boolean isInArea(int x, int y, int x2, int y2) {
if ((absX >= x && absX <= x2) && (absY <= y && absY >= y2)) return true;
if (isInArea(1000, 11000, 1000, 11000)) ???
return false;
}

I figured it out, but i dont know what to put on the end… what does return mean?[/quote]
The return statement exits from the current method, and control flow returns to where the method was invoked. The return statement has two forms: one that returns a value, and one that doesn’t. To return a value, simply put the value (or an expression that calculates the value) after the return keyword.

The data type of the returned value must match the type of the method’s declared return value. When a method is declared void, use the form of return that doesn’t return a value.

Read full topic

if (isInArea(1000, 11000, 1000, 11000)) ???
return false;
}

I figured it out, but i dont know what to put on the end… what does return mean?

item.title: How do I make the whole world Non Wild?
item.dc:creator: @Thecheeseman11 Thecheeseman11
item.description:
@Thecheeseman11 wrote:

Daman15jake your a moron, you just C&P what I typed…worst leecher I have ever seen… btw moron I gave him the coords…

[quote=“Thecheeseman11, post:6, topic:155005”]1.Kk open client.java and hit ctrl+F then type this:

public boolean nonWild() {

2.add this line right under the last one you see looking similar

(absX >=1000  && absX <=11000 && absY >=1000  && absY <=11000 )||

there you have it, whole runescape is safezone now =P coords personally found by me.[br][size=1]Posted on: October 28, 2007, 01:57:21 AM[/size][hr]Rofl mines much easier…I just tested that Mini tut I just posted and it worked for me perfectly… mine tells him exactly what to do and its 100% working with no errors…dont go telling him to delete attacking players…your out of your mind[/quote]

item.title: How do I make the whole world Non Wild?
item.dc:creator: @daman15jake daman15jake
item.description:
@daman15jake wrote:

.make A new one…
(absX >=XXXX && absX <=XXXX && absY >=XXXX && absY <=XXXX )||

  1. “absX” replace with the very most BOTTOM LEFT X coord. of the safe zone u want
    5.“absX number2” replace with the very most TOP RIGHT X coord of the safe zone u want
  2. “absY” replace with the very most BOTTOM LEFT Y coord. of the safe zone u want
    7.“absY number2” replace with the very most TOP RIGHT Y coord of the safe zone u want

and there you have it…

ALL THIS I JUST TYPED =P
